titles.title: A bill to disqualify from operating a commercial motor vehicle for life an individual who uses a commercial motor vehicle in committing a felony involving human trafficking.
No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act
No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act
No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act

No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act
No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act
No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act
No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

calendar.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Reported by Senator Thune without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 203.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.
By Senator Thune from Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation filed written report. Report No. 115-188.
Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1532.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 393 - 0 (Roll no. 710).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act (Sec. 2) This bill directs the Department of Transportation to disqualify from operating a commercial motor vehicle for life an individual who uses such a vehicle in committing a felony involving a severe form of human trafficking.
